p.s: The effect of a story on the reader is strongly influenced by the point of view and by different narrative techniques that the author uses.
Angie Thomas also takes advantage of this, by presenting Starr's state of mind through various narrative tehcniques and perspectives.
In this excerpt, the story is told from a first-person narrator.
That means that the perspective of one character, in this story from the perspective from the protagonist Starr Carter.
Therefore we only know Starr's thoughts, feelings and knowledge.
From that it concluded that we can symphatisesympathize easier with Starr causebecause we know the most about her.
Otherwise the narrative perspective is limited to the reader because we do not know the thoughts and feelings of some other characters.
This has the effect that the reader focussesfocuses his attention on Starr.
So we can understand her state of mind and her development from a girl who is afraid to speak to a confident girl who fights for the rights of her best-friendbest friend, better.
Thomas also presents this with the use of narrative techniques.
At the beginning of the excerpt, she uses some flashback for example Khalil drops it into the side of the door (l. 19) or He opens the door to ask if I'm okay (l. 21).
With the use of these flashbacks, she takes the story back in time.
This leadleads to an easier identification with Starr's feelings and makes it possible for the reader to understand wewhy she behaves in certain ways.
Thomas uses for this excerpt a scenic mode of presentation, in which she explained the situation in great detail.
This makes it easier for the reader to get the story clearly.
By the use of interior monologue, she creates a situation, that you can easily identify with.
All in all, Thomas tries to show the reader the development of Starr's state of mind from a girl who is afraid to speak to a confident girl.
